description: OAKLAND, Calif. (UPI)The Oakland Raiders will meet the Atlanta Falcons in an exhibition game at California Memorial Stadium in Berkeley, Saturday, Aug. 10.

title: Guardsmen Seek Long Hair
description: WASHINGTON, March 2 (UPI)The National Guard Association says it has asked the Air Force to allow the more than 90,000 Air Guardsmen to wear their hair longer or wear wigs. The association said in statement that the aim was to help remove a significant source of irritation among guardsmen and to further improve the Guard's recruiting potential.

title: CagneyThe Man Who Got Away
College instructor, mother and wife
description: WHEN I first moved to New York, I used to think that ten per cent of the people walking around the streets here would be either arrested or interviewed in any other city. That was, of course, in the days before people started looking slightly freaky in Milwaukee and Cleveland and Atlanta. But after years in New York, I still sometimes feel like a marketresearch interviewer who happened to show up on the night of the costume ball. A year or so ago, Alice, my Wife, and I were walking to one of our neighborhood movies along a street in the Village that seems to specialize in singular costuming, and we passed a citizen whose appearance stuck in my mind as we continued down the block. A few hundred feet later, while Alice was saying something about the film, I said, Excuse me, I hate to interrupt, but wasn't that fellow we just passed a onearmed bearded midget wearing a dress? Alice paused for a moment, and then said, I knew there was something about him that caught my attention. I told her I thought the process of becoming blas New Yorkers may have gone too far in our case, and she agreed; We decided that the next time we saw a onearmed bearded midget wearing a dress notice would be taken.

title: Letters To the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: State Seeks to Spur U.S. Transit Funds
description: TRENTONManuel Carballo, the. Deputy State Commission of Transportation, does not think that it makes much sense to talc about saving the state's environment or resolving its energy crisis without first making a major commitment to improving mass transit.

title: Mrs. Gandhi Ousts Party Chief In a State Racked by Violence
description: NEW DELHI, March 2 A fresh wave of violence swept the western state of Gujarat today as Prime Minister Indira Gandhi moved to end the twomonthlong agitation there over Price increases and political corruption.

title: Experiments in theatergoing Environmental Theater
description: The critic knows the way, Kenneth Tynan once quipped, but he can't drive. This could be the epitaph of every theatrical visionary, including Tynan, because a critic's work is usually on the page and not on the stage. When a critic tries to heal this split between esthetics and action, he moves from the comic to the heroic, from a place of safety and pride to uncertainty and selfdiscovery.

title: A pickled mouse for Christina Rossetti
HOUSE 6TERMER IN RARE CONTEST
description: CHICAGO, March. 2NorWily, Robert McClory, the sixterm Representative from the solidly Republican 13th District of Illinois, ignores primary elections.In the last 12 years he has not had a primary opponent, and he has grown accustomed in the general elections to easy majorities of more than 160 per cent in the threecounty district that encompasses Chicago's exurbia to the north and west.But this year there was Watergate, and the 66yearold Mr. McClory, the secondranking Republican on the House Judiciary Committee, has a young, articulate and active challenger in Edward M. Vass, 39, a former school teacher and probation officer who has served as administrative assistant to Illinois's Attorney General, William Scott. The primary election in IIlinois will be held March 19. Mr. Vass, who ays he is still a supporter of President Nixon, is calling for an impeachment vote by the full House of Representatives.

title: Kerr on Fashion
description: IT ISN'T often that you come across an entertainment that is lightly vulgar but the new Off Broadway musical version of Anna Cora Mowatt's Fashion is just such a crossbreed. Its format is wholly gratuitous, for one thing. Instead of plunging directly and wholeheartedly into Mrs. Mowatt's celebrated 19thcentury comedy  the first successful American play to be written by a womanit all too literally skirts the materials, pretending that a contemporary gaggle of Long Island matrons has come together to do the play, the only male in the cast their director.

title: Attendance, Bets Down At Westbury
description: WESTBURY, L. I., March 2Roosevelt Raceway ended its winter meeting tonight with attendance of almost 21 per cent and the handle down about 9 per cent compared with the same period last year.

description: If auto racing is banned in the United States, I'll move to another country, Bob Pagan said.

The child, the couple's second, is named Jocelyn Nicole. Her father is an account representative with CT Corporation System.

description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., March 2 (AP)Kathy Whitworth fired a fourunderpar 68 today to take the secondround lead in the 21st $30,000 Orange Blossom Classic on the Ladies Professional Golfers' Association Tour.

title: Art
description: OF the three photographers whose work of the 1920's and 1930's is currently the subject of an absorbing exhibition at the Museum of Modem Art  Andre Kertesz, Alexander Rodchenko and Laszlo MoholyNagy only Kertesz devoted himself exclusively to the photographic medium. (And only Kertesz remains among us, still copiously producing his magical images. On July 2, he will observe his 80th birthday.) Both Rodchenko and MoholyNagy are far better known as painters, sculptors and designers in the Constructivist mode, and both brought something of the Constructivist esthetic to bear on their photographic work.

description: DETROIT, March 2 (UPI) Mr. and Mrs. Ernest Dagostini have been paying taxes on their next door neighbor's home for 19 years by mistake.

title: An artist of gestures
description: Last night I saw upon the stair/ A little man who wasn't there/ He wasn't there again today...  but the footprints, the maddening scraps of paper collected in a green box, a white box, a score of iconoclastic readymades, an obscure book on chess, The Large Glass, a last assemblage and some two dozen paintings remain. The lives of artists, by and large, are not interesting: they meet other artists; they paint, travel, exhibit, resettle themselves and paint some more. Their romances go off like small firecrackers: the big explosion; the meaningful noises are all in the work. And sometimes the distance between the life and the work  the complex edifices they construct from a few simple ideas and a handful of experience  makes for great mystery. But with Marcel Duchamp, the personality funneled itself into the life and into the work in carefully measured doses. Life and work are equally devoted to coverup and mystification: the mechanical and the sexual made one and interchangeable, mental rather than visual art, roulette and chess superseding painting and sculpture.

title: Sunday Observer
description: My head aches more of late. It may be because of these conversations I keep hearing up there. Conversations among people I've never met, and going on right inside my head. An ugly development, surely. No wonder the thing aches. They say it will stop if I give up the newspapers, for the newspapers seem to bring on the conversations. But how can I do that? Give up the newspapers? How can a man go through life feeling absolutely rotten all the time like a good American if he has no newspapers to depress him?

title: Criminals At Large
description: Rabbi David Small, the hero of Harry Kemelman's popular series, is back again in TUESDAY THE RABBI SAW RED (Arthur Fields/Dutton, $6.95), and maybe time is running out on him. Kemelman started the series some years ago with Friday the Rabbi Slept Late. He then proceeded to Saturday, Sunday and Monday. Here we are on Tuesday. The question agitating the literary world, of course, is what Kernelman will do when he uses up all the days of the week. The New Critics cannot sleep nights worrying over the problem; rabbis all over the world are consulting the Apocrypha; little children cry themselves to sleep thiniting about the dilemma. But not to worry. If there are only seven days to the week, there are 12 months to the year. January the rabbi woke

title: Mate Lowers Ceiling on Welfare Rent
description: ALBANY, March 2The state announced today a new schedule of maximum rents for welfare recipients that will force an unknown number, possibly thousands, of familles to seek cheaper apartments.

title: Weekly Paper Purchased
description: WHEELING, W. Va., March 2 (UPI)Ogden Newspapers, Inc., has announced the purchase of the group's 12th newspaper and first weekly publication, The Breeze, at Cape Laurel, Fla.

title: The current favorite performers include Stewart Udall and a descendant of Dracula
description: Who in his right mind would sit voluntarily, for two hours in a drafty gym listening to Art Buchwald talk when he could read him over breakfast in the daily paper? Who of good sense would trek halfway across town in the slashes of March to hear Hugh Downs, instead of simply tuning him in on TV? Nobody, one would suppose, yet today millions of Americans are dressing up, going out and paying an amount estimated to be as high as $100million annually for the privilege of hearing other people talk At a time when the mass media are already bombarding us with more information than we can possibly absorb, the archaic art of the public lecture is, in fact, booming.

title: Who Will Pay for the Injustice of the Past?
description: Our Constitution is colorblind, and neither knows nor tolerates classes among citizens.

title: Headliners
description: Attorney Melvin Bell, who has defended clients ranging from Jack Ruby, the convicted murderer Lee Harvey Oswald, to Carol Doda, a wellknown West Coast stripper, won't be doing any legal work at all for the next 30 days. In a 6.1 decision, the California State Supreme Court suspended Mr. Belli from practicing law for a month, rulin$ that he violated a state ruling prohibiting lawyers from soliciting employment by advertising or other means. The court particularly objected to advertisements in which Mr. Belli endorsed a brand of Scotch.

title: The rites of spring for a successful single
description: SHE loves clothes, so much so that she spends well over $1,000 a year for them. She is crazy about films, tennis and travel. She has had her fling with analysis and singles bars, and survived the usual disastrous affair with a married man. She lives alone on the East Side and when she's showering she often imagines she hears strange noiseslike almost everybody else who has seen Tony Perkins commit shower mayhem in the movie, Psycho.

title: Judith Anne Hoersting, Nurse, Wed
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., March 2  Miss Judith Anne Hoersting, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Louis Hoersting of Largo, Fla., was married here today to Jeffrey Brownold Lowenfels, son of Mr. and Mrs. Frederick Lowenfels of Scarsdale, N. Y. The Unitarian ceremony was performed in the Great Hall of the Harvard Lampoon Castle by the Rev. Ronald Whittler.

title: BLEY LEADS SCORPIO IN A JAZZ CONCERT
description: Paul Bley, a pianist whose career for the last dozen or more years has been spent on the far out fringes of jazz, seems to be moving toward a more direct, easily assimilable form of music. His concert Thursday evening with his fourpiece group, Scorpio, in Columbia University's Wollman Auditorium, was full of surprisingly romantic ideas and, by and large, a forthright, swinging approach.

title: About the Yankees ...
description: Bobby Murcer's signing left Sparky Lyle, Horace Clarke and Celerino Sanchez as the only unsigned Yankees ... Someone asked Bill Virdon if managers ever hold out. They're like secondstringers, the manager replied. They hold on. ... Otto Velez, who has a chance win the right field job, reported to camp, one day late. ... Marvin Miller and Dick Moss of the Players Association held a preworkout meeting with the players and informed them about a new provision in the pension plan that will allow players to invest as much as 10 per cent of their salaries in a mutual fund plan to be administered by baseball's pension committee.... Murcer bought a fourseat box at Shea Stadium for $1,000, the first player Gabe Paul knows of to do such a thing.... Why are you wearing Sudakis's number? someone asked Lou Piniella, who was wearing Sttdakis's 44 shirt instead of his 14. I am? he replied. I thought I was wearing 14.

The mansion is Merriewold West, the country estate of Dr. and Mrs. Victor D'Arc.

title: South Shore, Chicago's First MiddleClass Black Section, Fighting Decay
description: CHICAGOThe decline and fall of aging neighborhoods here and in many other cities are pointed reminders, sad harbingers. The prophets of gloom are legion. The thumbs of many urban experts are down.

title: RUH FACES RACE TO RETAIN POST
description: Richard H. Kuh, who is serving as Manhattan District Attorney by appointment of Governor Wilson and who plans to run, for the office this year, already has on opponent for the Democratic nomination, and other Democrats are weighing a race.

title: Defendant's Brief
description: Sounding ever more like lawyers for the defense rather than public servants on the White. House staff, President Nixon's Watergate attorneys have submitted their brief arguing that only violations of the criminal. code can justify, impeachment. Considering their client's circumstances, this argument is not surprising; it stands, however, in opposition to bipartisan studies of the House Judiciary Committee staff and a number of other legal bodies, who argue that impeachment can also be grounded on abuses of power beyond the scope of the statutes.

title: On an Ego Trip With Don Quichotte
description: SARAH CALDWELL'S recent production of Massenet's Don Quichotte in Boston raises once again the problem of fidelity to an opera. In one way, at least, we have progressed beyond the bad old days. When Mozart's Magic Flute was presented in Paris at the turn of the 19th century, the score was maltreated, the libretto was changed, and Mozart would have found much of his opera unrecognizable. Today, by common convention, the actual music of an opera of the past is no longer touched. We expect to hear the notes as the composer wrote them. But the libretto! That is another matter. In the name of bringing an opera into the 20th century, or making it more palatable for audiences, or reinterpreting it, or finding previously unsuspected psychological readings, or whatever, a libretto is fair game.

title: EFFORT ON TO SHE 2 GOTHIC BUILDINGS
description: Efforts to save the two Gothic Revival houses on Fourth Avenue that Grace Church, their owner, intends to replace with a gymnasium, have intensified, with the formation last week of a citizens committee to raise funds to assist in the preservation effort.

International Airport, apparently of a heart attack, after having returned from a business trip. He was 67 years old and lived at 160 East 65th Street.

Garone, son of Mrs. Sabine Garone and the late Mr. Garone. Both families are of Brooklyn. Miss Facciola is a junior at Newton College of the Sacred Heart. China's, tanker Jinhu delivered the first shipment to Kashima in Ibaraki prefecture on Sept. 17, 1973.
