title: U.S. Report Lowers Wheat Export Figure
description: Wheat export bookings as of Feb. 24 totaled 1.28 billion bushels, the Government reported yesterday. The figure was revised downward from 1.32 billion bushels the previous week, indicating a more optimistic outlook for the dwindling wheat supplies. The report was issued after the close of the commodity markets.

title: RHEINGOLD SALE ASSURES FUTURE
description: Chock Full O'Nuts took over the Rheingold breweries from Pepsico yesterday at a jolly, backpatting andat one point  splashy ceremony at City Hall.

title: Pact Reached in Ethiopia General Strike
description: ADDIS ABABA, Ethiopia, March 8 (AP  Negotiators reached agreement today on formula to end a brief general strike that had severely affected transportation, food and tourist industries in this East African nation.

title: Justice Department Opposes Amnesty As Hearings Begin
description: WASHINGTON, March 8 (AP) The Justice Department contended today that Congress would interfere with President Nixon's powers if it granted amnesty for Vietnam war deserters and draft evaders.

title: SHOP TALK This Porcelain Adorns the Neck, Not the Table
description: Most people think of porcelain in terms of ornaments and dinnerware  Ming vases, Royal Copenhagen and Meissen figurines, Svres dinner services, Boehm bird sculptures and the like. But to Sandra Pailet, porcelain is something else again: an absolutely elegant material for jewelry.

title: Mills Feels Nixon Will Quit After Report on His Taxes
description: LITTLE ROCK, Ark., March Representative Wilbur D. Mills predicted today that a Congressional report next month on President Nixon's income tax payments would increase pressure for him to resign. For that and other reasons, he said, he believes very strongly that Mr. Nixon will resign.

title: WHITE HOUSE BILL ON ENERGY DRAWN
description: WASHINGTON, March 8Federal energy officials, in cooperation with the White House, drafted today what they called a barebones emergency energy bill that would include authority for President Nixon to impose fuel rationing if he considered it necessary.

title: State Promises Gasoline for Shore Visitors
description: SPRING LAKE HEIGHTS, March 8Commissioner Joseph A. Hoffman of the State Department of Labor and Industry today promised state action to assure a banner summer vacation season at the New Jersey shore despite the gasoline shortage.

title: BRASCO AIDE CITES HANDSOFF POLICY
description: The administrative assistant to Representative Frank J. Brasco said here yesterday at Mr. Brasco's conspiracycorruption trial that Mr. Brasco adopted a handsoff policy toward a trucking company after learning it was controlled by a reputed Mafia captain.

title: Yugoslav Women Get Day Off and Some Bad News
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, March 8  Yugoslav housewives and working women, who must normally put up with one of the most unabashedly maleoriented societies in the world, observed Women's Day today by coaxing their husbands to take them out of lunch.

title: Museum Sells Bits of Itself at FundRaiser
description: Barbara Johnson paid $530 for a whale's glass eye because as long as she can remember she has loved whales. Lila Healy bought the plaster of paris fin mostly for the memories of when she was young.

title: NESTLE MAKES A BID IN COSMETIC FIELD
description: GENEVA, March 8Nestl, Switzerland's biggest company, with worldwide activities in the food industry, proposes to expand into the cosmetics and related fields by acquiring a minorilty interest in L'Oreal, a French multinational corporation.

title: Tapes of Housing Trials Are Erased Accidentally
description: The proceedings of as many as 25 trials conducted in the city's new Housing Court over the last four months have unWittingly been erased from the tapes on which they were recorded, the judge in charge of the court acknowledged yesterday.

title: PRESIDENT URGES CAMPAIGN REFORM WITH GIFT LIMITS
description: WASHINGTON, March 8 President Nixon proposed today to lead the cleanup of political campaigns.

title: Soviet Sees Wide Purge in China, Aimed at Officials at All Levels'
description: MOSCOW, March 8  The Soviet press, offering Moscow's first public assessment of the current turmoil inside China, has forecast a broad new purge chiefly directed toward officials at all levels of the Chinese Government.

title: 2 Men Repairing Jet Find Themselves in Fix
description: Two Eastern Airlines mechanics accidentally locked themselves inside a cargo compartment of a Lockheed 1011 jumbo jet at La Guardia Airport yesterday, causing a delay of two hours

title: Cable TV, Overextended, Is in Retreat in Cities
description: Cable television companies made a rush to wire the cities when the Federal Communications Commission, on March 31, 1972, issued new rules that effectively lifted a longstanding freeze on the top 100 television markets, but what many had thought would result in a communications revolution by 1974 has instead turned into a massive retreat last yearcame down, in the final analysis, to the urban consumer's relative indifference to the kinds of cable service offered.

title: South Africa Takes Lead In Davis Cup
description: BOGOTA, Colombia, March 8 (UPI)South Africa took a 20 lead against Chile in the South American zone final of the Davis Cup tennis series today on singles victories by Cliff Drysdale and Bob Hewitt in the opening of the elimination round.

title: Water Projects Bill Signed
description: WASHINGTON, March 8 (AP) President Nixon signed the Water Resources Development Act Into law yesterday, thereby authorizing engineering and design for water projects costing up to $1.3billion.

title: Policeman Is Slain by Gunman Outside Queens Bar
description: A New York policeman was fatally shot early today while wrestling with a holdupman outside a tavern in Jamaica, Queens.

title: Court Told Gross Advised Witness to Lie to U.S. Jury
description: NEWARK, March 8The former president of the Triple S Blut Stamp Company testified today that Nelson G. Gross advised him to disguise a $5,000 contribution to former Gov. William T. Cahill's 1969 campaign and later to lie about it to a Federal grand jury.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A 25yearold massageparlor employe was shot fatally early yesterday in what the police here said was a dispute with two offduty Hoboken police officers. The shooting was at the Orange Plaza Massage Parlor, 301 West 48th Street, off Eighth Avenue. The victim, identified as Theodore Allen Lein of Palmdale, Calif., was pronounced dead on arrival at Polyclinic Hospital.

title: Bridge: Grand National Team Finals Slated Here This Weekend
description: The concluding stages of the Grand National team championship for New York City and Long Island will be played this weekend at the New York Hilton Hotel. In the semifinal stage, beginning today at 1:30 P.M., teams headed by Edgar Kaplan and Ronald Blau meet in one match, while groups led by Sam Stayman and Ralph Pollen clash in the other.

title: 2 BROTHERS HELD IN LI, KIDNAPPING
description: The Federal Bureau of Investigation announced last night the arrest of two brothers froth New Jersey in connection with the kidnapping of 8yearold John Calzadilla of Dix Hills, L. I.

title: Jury Deliberations Begin In Murder Trial of Squire
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, March 8 A Middlesex County court jury late this afternoon began deliberating a verdict in the murder trial of Clark E. Squire, a reputed member of the Black Liberation Army.

title: Ballet: Ashton's Dream
description: The Dream, Sir Frederick Ashton's 1964 treatment of A Midsummer Night's Dream and Twyla Tharp's recent As Time Goes By were the new highlights of the City Center Joffrey Ballet's fall season. Both ballets made a happy return Thursday night at the City Center.

title: Out of Order
description: Last week the House Rules Committee knifed the land use planning bill even though it had been approved overwhelmingly by the Senate and by the House Interior Committee. This week the Rules Committee killed the compromise mass transit bill even though it had previously been approved by both houses. The public has a right to askwhat's going on here?

title: Market Place:
description: Edward M. Syring Jr., chief economist for the Marine Midland Banks, has taken a look at profit prospects of the business community, and what he finds is that the past Is not prologue.

title: Wheat: Prosperity Not ProblemFree
description: POTTER, Neb., March 4For the last few days, the sun has been shining benevolently on the flat tablelands of the Nebraska Panhandle, drawing the frost from the dark earth and bringing new green life to the thousands of acres of wheat that stretch to every horizon.

title: Gleason Promises To Support Center For Meat Imports
description: NEWARK, March 8 (AP) Ted Gleason, president of the International Longshoremen's Association, said today that his union would cooperate with management in every way possible to assure the success of a facilitynow being built here to handle frozen imported meats.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: SCHOOLING All sorts of school benefits, with entertainment, this weekend. At New York University's Loeb Student Center, Washington Square South and La Guardia Place, tomorrow at 8: Alan Arkin, Jack Gilford (The Sunshine Boys), Paul Dooley (Raisin), the Paper Bag Players, Michael's Pub Jazz Band, the Untouchables. All for th Village Community School's fifth Village Lights Show, Rita Moreno, M.C. Admission, $10 to $50 (9823843).

title: N.C. State Gains Final In A.C.C.
description: GREENSBORO, N. C., March 8 (UPI)David Thompson scored 37 points and led topranked North Carolina State to an 87.86 victory over Virginia in the semifinals of the Atlantic Coast Conference basketball tournament tonight.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: In the otherwise laudatory March 5 editorial on the pending Senate legislation to establish public financing of all Federal primaries and general elections, The Times has for the second time in recent weeks perpetuated the erroneous interpretation that the bill forces a candidate in the general election to choose between exclusively public and exclusively private financing.

title: S.E.C. SAYS BISHOP TARGET OF SWINDLE
description: DETROIT, March 8 (AP) The Securities and Exchange Commission has filed suit in Federal court, alleging the Catholic Archdiocese of Detroit, a Michigan bishop and several lay persons were swindled out of $340,000 by the stock promoters of a Florida real estate concern.

title: Richmond Coach Resigns
description: RICHMOND, March 8 (AP) Frank Jones resigned today as head football coach at the University of Richmond after holding the job for eight years.

title: Open Interest
description: Friday, March 8, 1974

title: Cost Council Lift's Controls on Paper; Sharp Rises Seen
description: WASHINGTON, March 8The Cost of Living Council decontrolled today the $31billion paper industry, clearing the way for sharp increases in the price of pulp, paper and paper products over the next few months. The decontrol is effective immediately.

title: The Etiquette of Streaking
description: WASHINGTON, March 8  Once again we go to the mailbag of Miss Cornelia de Rigor, world's foremost authority on correct behavior.

title: Targ Leaves Putnam Post, A Peppery Critic of Trade
description: William Targ, the strappini bibliophile, anthologist and all around bookman, stepped down as editor in chief at Putnam's this week  and got off some withering criticisms of shoddy publishers, hogwashprone literary agents and astronomical advance payments.

title: PRESIDENT URGES CAMPAIGN REFORM WITH GIFT LIMITS
description: WASHINGTON, March 8President Nixon proposed today to lead the cleanup of political campaigns.

title: N.C. State, Maryland Gain Final
description: GREENSBORO, N. C., March 8 (UPI)David Thompson scored 37 points and led topranked North Carolina State to an 8766 victory over Virginia in the semifinals of the Atlantic Coast Conference basketball tournament tonight.

title: Irish, Marquette Begin N.C.A.A. Playoffs Today
description: TERRE HAUTE, Ind,. March aThe 36th annual National Collegiate Athletic Association basketball tournament, which begins tomorrow at six sites from New York City to Pocatello, Idaho, may have in action as few as two of the nation's five topranked teams and certainty, will not have than three.

title: Notes on People Solti to Pass His Paris Baton to Barenboim
description: Daniel Barenboim, the 31yearold Israeliborn pianist and conductor, will succeed Sir Georg Solti as chief conductor of France's top symphony orchestra, the Orchestre de Paris. The appointment was announced yesterday by the new Minister of Culture, Alain Peyrefitte. Sir Georg, who has been spiltting his batonwaving between the Paris orchestra and the Chicago Symphony, was reported to have asked to be relieved of his Paris chores. Mr. Barenboim, who makes his headquarters in London, is married to the cellist Jacqueline du Pr. He takes over in Paris in September, 1975.

title: Dr. Pyotr K. Anokhin Is Dead; A Soviet Neurophysiologist, 76
description: MOSCOW, March 8 (AP)Dr. Pyotr K. Anokhin, a pioneering Soviet brain specialist and a celebrated physiologist, died Wednesday, the Communist Party newspaper Pravda reported today. He was 76 years old.

title: ISRAEL SAYS SYRIA PLANNED ATTACK TO REGAIN SALIENT
description: JERUSALEM, March 8Premier Golda Meir charged tonight that Syria had planned military action earlier this week to recapture the enclave of Syrian territory that Israel seized during the October war.

title: Speaker Saves Diner's Life
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., March 8 (AP)A prominent Boston surgeon, the main speaker at a Gridiron Club banquet, saved the life of a dinner guest with an emergency tracheotomy tonight. Dr. Earle Wayne Wilkins Jr. used a policeman's pocket knife to perform the surgery on Richard Dwyer, 53 years old, of Arlington. Mr. Dwyer, a member of the Harvard University athletic department, collapsed while eating dinner.

title: McCord Charges Nixon Fatally Infected His Case
description: WASHINGTON, March 8James W. McCord Jr., the convicted Watergate conspirator. has accused President Nixon of having fatally infected his trial proceedings early last year by suppressing and concealing evidence of the Watergate coverup.

title: Mount Vernon Five Tops Poughkeepsie
description: WHITE PLAINS, March 8Mount Vernon High School defeated Potighkeepsie, 9275, to win the Class AAA open championship and Peekskill edged Oakwood, 5958, to capture the Class BC open at the state Section 1 basketball tournament tonight at the Westchester County Center.

title: Acquisition Insures Rheingold Survival
description: Chock Full O'Nuts took over the Rheingold breweries from Pepsico yesterday at a jolly, backpatting andat one point  splashy ceremony at City Hall.

title: TURETSKY ASSERTS OIL CONCERNS LIE
description: The Federal Energy Office administrator here, Gerald J. Turetsky, said yesterday that he had sufficient evidence to warrant civil and possible criminal complaints against several large oil companies for allegedly lying and cheating about gasoline supplies here in the last two months.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: PRINCESS ANNE, Md., March 8 (UPI)Tom Nelson, a cocaptain of the MarylandEastern Shore basketball team, which competes next week in the National Invitational Tournament, was charged today with ripping down copper drain pipes at the school and selling them for scrap Nelson, 23 years old, a senior, and Alfred James, 20, halfback on the Hawks' football team, have been formally charged with grand larceny and receiving stolen goods, said the Somerset County assistant state's attorney, Logan Widdowson.

title: British Rents Frozen for Rest of Year
description: LONDON, March 6Britain's new Government made its first formal move against inflation today, announcing a national freeze on residential rents for the rest of the year.

title: Westinghouse Cuts 500
description: PITTSBURGH, March 8 (UPI) The Westinghouse Electric Corporation announced yesterday that reduced sales had forced it to furlough 500 employes at seven of its lamp manufacturing plants, including three in New Jersey.

title: People in Sports
description: In his transcendental career in the National Basketball Association, Kareem AbdulJabbar has played in only one winning regularseason game at Madison Square Garden. That happened in January, 1970. Tonight he and his Milwaukee Bucks teammates go after their first victory here after nine straight losses to the Knicks.

title: Museum Sells Bits of Itself at FundRaiser
description: Barbara Johnson paid $530 for a whale's glass eye because as long as she can remember she has loved whales. Lila Healy bought the plaster of paris fin mostly for the memories of when she was young.

title: Soviet Figure Skaters Win Fifth World Dance Title
description: MUNICH, March 8 (AP)Ludmila Pachomova and Alexander Gorshkov won the world ice dancing crown today for a record fifth consecutive year. The victory gave the Soviet Union a sweep of the pair titles at the world figure skating championships at the Olympic Sports Hall.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Turnpike Accidents Lowest in 10 Years

title: News Summary and Index SATURDAY, MARCH 9, 1974
description: Premier Golda Meir of Israel charged that Syria had planned military action earlier this week to recapture the enclave of Syrian territory that Israel seized during the October war. Mrs. Meir said that Israel had immediately asked foreign governments to do what they could to avoid a new outbreak of fighting. This was assumed to be an allusion to the United States, which has been in direct contact with Syria, and the Soviet Union to work out ways to defuse the Syrian front. [1:1.]

title: A SixHorse Field Is Nothing to Cough At
Canada Finding Pride and Identity in Her Literature
description: PORT COLBORNE, Ontario, March 8Some of Canada's bestknown novelists, poets and critics gathered in the high school of this agreeable Lake Erie community today for a proud and exuberant celebration of Canadian literature.

title: Kennedy Hints at Payola In Drug Sales Promotion
description: WASHINGTON, March 8 Senator Edward M. Kennedy charged the pharmaceutical industry today with practices that sometimes border on payola in promoting sales of the industry's products.

title: All Montreal Lies in Wait For Ranger Visit Tonight
Business Briefs
description: LONDON, March 8 (UPI)The price of gold and the dollar lost some ground today on most foreign markets. Gold had been higher at the outset, but dropped sharply in many places later. By late afternoon in London gold had lost $6.50 an ounce to $164 and in Zurich gold closed at $166 an ounce, down $4 during the day.

title: Art: Ad Reinhardt's Earlier Period
description: The temptation to identify an artist's entire life's work with the most extreme and specialized aspect of his development was especially strong in the case of Ad Reinhardt. In the decade preceding his death in 1967, Reinhardt had perfected a mode of abstract painting that seemed, at first glance at least, committed to a radical invisibility. On a square black, field the painter placed a hardedge symmetrical nearblack form, and these blackonblack paintings required a certain patienceindeed, a kind of prolonged meditationon the part of the spectator before their minimal design could be adequately discerned.

title: Ford Not Expecting New Bombshells In Watergate Case
description: TAMPA, Fla., March 8Vice President Ford said today that he did not believe there would be further Watergate bombshells.

title: MITCHELL PROMISE ON DEAN ALLEGED
description: Just weeks before the 1972 Presidential election, John N. Mitchell promised to talk to John W. Dean 3d, then President Nixon's counsel, in a last(minute effort to avert the exposure before Election Day of a secret $200,000 campaign (contribution, a Government witness testified yesterday.fraught with ironies. Mr. Mitchell, for instance, is charged with perjury under the new false declarations before grand jury or court statute, which ;was enacted at his behest when he was the Attorney General and noted far his law and order stance.

title: Bridge Lane to Be Closed
description: The outer lane on the lower level of the Queensboro Bridge traffic for emergency repairs will be closed to Queensbound for three days, the Traffic Department announced yesterday. The Consolidated Edison Company closed the bridge at A.M. yesterday to repair faulty power cables under the roadway. The lane should be open for Queensbound traffic by Monday morning, the Traffic Department said.

title: CLOTHING WORKERS ACCEPT FARAH PACT
description: EL PASO, March 8 (AP) Union clothing workers have agreed to end a bitter strike and companion boycott against the Farah Manufacturing Company that started in 1972 and caused the company to close several plants. Union clothing workers have agreed to end a bitter strike and companion boycott against the Farah Manufacturing Company that started in 1972 and caused the company to close several plants.

title: U.S. Cancels Meeting With Europeans
description: WASHINGTON, March 8The State Department today announced the postponement Of a meeting that United States officials had tentatively scheduled for next Wednesday with representatives of the European Common Market. No new date was set.

title: Canadians Will Push Sale To Cuba Despite U.S. Ban
description: OTTAWA, March 8  An American  owned company in Canada decided today to go ahead with plans to sell 25 locomotives to Cuba, although the transaction violates the United States TradingwiththeEnemy Act. Also today, the Government forecast legislation to prevent the operation of United States law here in future cases of the same kind.

title: Nixon Tax Returns Printed in Tabloid By Philadelphians
description: PHILADELPHIA, March 8A collection of what the publishers describe as copies of President Nixon's income tax returns from 1969 through 1972 was published here today in a 16page tabloid magazine.

title: Reynolds Urges Aluminum Price Rise
description: The head of the nation's secondlargest aluminum producer said earlier this week that the primary aluminum price should be allowed to reach the 35centapound level.

title: WINE TALK A Romanee Tasting, or How Not to Show Off the Very Best
description: The town of VosneRomane in the center of the Cte de Nuits, has often been called the pearl in the Burgundian necklace because so many great wines originate there.

title: Steel Unit Plans Controls
description: The Republic Steel Corporation announced yesterday plans for a $28million modernization and airpollution control program at its central alloy district at Canton, Ohio.

title: Cargo Door Clue Studied In Crash of Turkish Plane
description: The Turkish jumbo jet that crashed near Paris Sunday, killing a record total of 346 persons, apparently had not had its rear cargo door completely modified in accord with safety recommendations of the manufacturer, sources close to the inquiry said yesterday.

title: 3 ExAides Indicted In Middlesex County
description: A Middlesex County grand jury indicted three former Madison Township officials yesterday on charges of attempting to influence other local officials into voting approval of several major realestate subdivisions.

title: The Hippopotamus Hound of Capitol Hill
description: WASHINGTONWhat happens when a hippopotamus thinks he ought to run like a greyhound? Quite simply, he makes mistakes.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: All flours Given in Daylight Saving Time

title: Anker Gives Brooklyn Plan To Integrate High Schools
description: A new Brooklyn schoolzoning plan that establishes that by 1977 each academic high school in the borough must have an enrollment at least 30 per cent black and Puerto Rican was announced yesterday by Chancellor Irving Anker.

title: The Streak Strikes Out in Race For Princeton Student President
description: PRINCETON, March 8 Quentin D. Easier beat two unorthodox candidates yesterday to win the presidency of Princeton University's student government.

title: Economic Adviser Takes Middle Road
description: William J. Fellner carne to New York yesterday and tried, to shoot down both the optimists and the pessimists among his economist peers.

title: FEMINISTS PROTEST POLICY OF THE TIMES
description: About 50 members of feminist groups demonstrated outside the offices of The New York Times at 229 West 43d Street yesterday to protest what they described as the newspaper's editorial and classified advertising policies and practices which have shown resistance to women's equality and have helped perpetuate sex discrimination.

title: Opera: Gotterdammerung Completes the Ring
description: About a half dozen years after it started, the Metropolitan Opera has finally brought its new Ring cycle to a close. Last night Gotterdiinunerung was staged, and it followed, more or less, the lines of the previous three operas of the Wagner cycle. It was based on Herbert von Karajan's version, with sets and projections by Gunther SchneiderSiemssen, staged by Wolfgang Weber, and with costumes by George Wakhevitch.

title: Ford Planning Layoffs
description: DETROIT, March 8P (UPI)The Ford Motor Company said today that 16,000 workers at four assembly plant and seven parts and manufacturing plants face oneand twoweek layoffs this month because of the continued cutback in bigcar production.

title: Unemployed Rate at 5.2%, Halting 3Month Increase
description: WASHINGTON, March 8 The nation's unemployment rate held steady at 5.2 per cent of the labor force in February after three months of increases, the Labor Department reported today.

title: Panel in Search of Hospital Chief Gives Board Choice of 4 Names
description: A special search committee seeking a new president for the city's Health and Hospitals Corporation decided yesterday to give the board of directors the names of four candidates for the $65,000ayear post.

title: WHEAT FUTURES DECLINE BY LIMIT
description: The major commodity markets, which have recently beer taking their cue on prices from the price of gold in European markets, showed a little more Independence yesterday and a tendency to react to fundamentale of supply and demand.

title: Patent Office Overseer Wins One for Invention
description: WASHINGTON, March 8Dr. Betsy AnckerJohnson, who as Assistant Secretary of Commerce for Science and Technology supervises the Patent Office, was herself granted a patent this week. She retains no personal interest in Patent 3,795,803, as it is assigned to the Boeing Company, Seattle, her former employer. The application was filed in 1972, and President Nixon nominated her for office the following year.

title: Mills Feels Nixon Will Quit After Report on His Taxes
description: LITTLE ROCK, Ark., March Representative Wilbur D. Mills predicted today that a Congressional report next month on President Nixon's income tax payments would increase pressure for him to resign. For that and other reasons, he said, he believes very strongly that Mr. Nixon will resign.

title: Callous Eviction
description: The early morning raid at Shawnee, Pa., last week was carried out with the military precision of an action against a fortified enemy outpost. But the victims of the raiding party of ninety Federal marshals armed with pistols and gas canisters were not part of an enemy force; they were peaceful squatters on Federal land near the site of the proposed Tocks Island Dam on the Delaware River, where some of them had farmed the land for the past four years.

title: Irish, Marquette Begin N.C.A.A.Playoffs Today
description: TERRE HAUTE, Ind,. March 8The 36th annual National Collegiate Athletic Association basketball tournament, which begins tomorrow at six sites from New. York City to Pocatello, Idaho, may have in action as few as two of the nation's five topranked teams and certainly will not have more than three.

title: TOURING MRS. NIXON IS SEEN OFF BY STAFF
description: White House staff members staged a farewell for Mrs. Nixon today as she and President Nixon left for a Florida weekend. It was also the first leg of a LatinAmerican trip for Mrs. Nixon as the President's ambassador.

title: GIFT DISCLOSURE OUTLINED BY S.E. C.
description: WASHINGTON, March 8  The conviction of any corporation, or any of its officers or directors, for making an illegal political campaign contribution is a material fact that should be disclosed to the public and its stockholders, the Securities and Exchange Commission's division of corporate finance said today.

title: Troubles Haunted Middletown Suicide
description: MIDDLETOWN, N.Y., March 8  Everyone in this town knew Joe Lercara, Edward Kristel said today, gazing down North Street from a card and gift shop, but in the end, I guess, nobody really knew him.

title: NEWS INDEX
description: News Summary and Index, Page 31

title: DR. HERMAN WELKOWITZ
description: Dr. Herman Welkowitz, a dentist on the Lower East Side from 1917 to 1964, known to thousands as Doctor Harry, died Monday at the Jewish Home and Hospital, 120 West 106th Street. He was 81 years old.

title: TURETSKY ASSERTS OIL CONCERNS LIE
description: The Federal Energy Office administrator here, Gerald J. Turetsky, said yesterday that he had sufficient evidence to warrant civil and possible criminal complaints against several large oil companies for allegedly lying and cheating about gasoline supplies here in the last two months.

title: Mobil Oil Gets $500 Fine For Gasoline With Fuel Oil
description: MINEOLA, L. I., March 8 The Mobil Oil Corporation pleaded guilty in First District Court here today to a charge by the Nassau County Office of Consumer Affairs that a companyowned station in Baldwin had sold gasoline contaminated with, fuel oil.

title: JACQUELINE BRITT
description: Jacqueline Britt, musicalcomedy actress and mezzosoprano of 310 West 71st Street, was injured fatally Wednesday in an elevator accident do the Supreme Court building, 60 Centre Street. Her age was 29.

title: McCord Charges Nixon Fatally Infected His Case
description: WASHINGTON, March 8James W. McCord Jr., the convicted Watergate conspirator. has accused President Nixon of having fatally infected his trial proceedings early last year by suppressing and concealing evidence of the Watergate coverup.

title: 2 Held in L.I. Kidnapping; F.B.I. Is Seeking Others
description: The Federal Bureau of Investigation announced last night the arrest of two young brothers from Union City, N. J., in connection with the kidnapping of 8yearold John Calzadilla of Dix Hills, L.I.

title: S. E. C. MODIFIES STOCK TAPE PLAN
description: WASHINGTON, March 8 The Securities and Exchange Commission decided today on a compromise with the securities industry in order to expedite the development of a con solidated tape reporting stock prices and volume as part of a central market system.

title: Aussie Ahead in Golf
description: IPOH, Malaysia, March 8 (AP)  Michael Ferguson of Australia carded a second straight threeunderpar 69 and took a onestroke lead today after two rounds of the Malaysian open. Tied for second were Wally Kuchar of Edgewater, Fla., and Graham Marsh of Australia.

title: Italian Defeats John L.
description: John L. Sullivan came into Madison Square Garden last night with an illustrious name and a reputation to match the legendary John L., the Boston strongboy.

title: Flames Top North Stars, Move to 3d
description: ATLANTA, March 8 (AP) The Atlanta Flames beat the Minnesota North Stars 31, tonight for their third straight victory and climbed back into third place in the West Division of the National Hockey League.

title: News. Summary and Index
description: SATURDAY, MARCH 9, 1974

title: Woman May Get U.S. Post
description: WASHINGTON, March 8 (AP)Dr. Virginia Trotter, vicel chancellor of the University of Nebraska, has been picked, for the Presidential appointment as Assistant Secretary for Education, it was reported today.

title: ARAB OIL CUTBACK CALLED ON TARGET
description: The productioncutback aspect of the Arab oil weapon has been almost totally effective, the Exxon Corporation indicated yesterday.

title: Austrians 1,2 in Ski Cup Finale
description: VYSOKE TATRY, Czechslovakia, March 8 (AP)Monika Kaserer and AnneMarie Proell of Austria finished one, two in a giant slalom today and wound up two, one in the final standing for the World Cup of Alpine skiing.

title: Stocks Ride Seesaw On Oil Uncertainties
description: The stock market dropped in the morning and then rose in the afternoon yesterday to finish with good gains.

title: Peron Gets Power to Take Over Embattled Province
description: BUENOS AIRES, March 8President Juan Domingo Pern won the approval of the Chamber of Deputies today for his request that he be allowed to replace the deposed Governor of COrdoba with a federal official.

title: Public Debate Is Urged On Schools in the North
description: The opening session of the spring educational conference of the United Federation of Teachers heard Schools Chancellor Irving Anker make an appeal for public debate on the crisis of de facto segregation in urban schools throughout the North.

title: MITCHELL PROMISE ON DEAN ALLEGED
description: Just weeks before the 1972 Presidential election, John N. Mitchell promised to talk to John W. Dean 3d, then President Nixon's counsel, in a lastminute effort to avert the exposure before Election Day of a secret $200,000 campaign contribution, a Government witness testified yesterday.

title: In the Remote Bush of Kenya, Nonviolent Human Nature in Action
description: NAIROBI, KenyaOne problem with living in Africa is that it takes so long to get the new books. There's Erich Fromm's latest, The Anatomy of Human Destructivenees, for instance.

title: Belgium's Freeze on Oil Prices Pleases the Voters but Outrages Companies
description: BRUSDELS, March 8Belgium's major political parties, facing a national election on Sunday, have agreed to freeze oil prices until midApril.

title: Finley Frees Williams To Any Club bat Yanks
description: OAKLAND, Calif., March 8 (UPI)  The Oakland A's owner, Charles O. Finley, released his former manager, Dick Williams, from his contract, tonight, permitting him to join any club except the New York Yankees.

title: Oil Strike Lifts Sagging Spirits in India
description: NEW DELHI, March 8 A new oil strike in the Arabian sea bed north of Bombay has eased the mood of depression here over the economic crisis and the problems caused by the vastly increased price of oil.

title: EDWARD THURSTON JR.
description: SHARON, Conn., March 8 Edward Day Thurston Jr., retired mechanical engineer who had been a consulting engineer with Columbia University, the Gulf Oil Company and other concerns, died Wednesday at his home here. His age was 91.

title: Excerpts From Nixon's Radio Address
description: Following are excerpts from a transcript of President Nixon's broadcast address on campaign reform yesterday afternoon, as recorded by The New York Times, through the facilities of A.B.C. News:

title: Antiques: Toby Jugs
description: The jovial fellow in a tricorm hat, breeches and buckled shoes, balancing a mug of beer on his chubby kneesthat's Toby, a character of such enduring appeal in ceramic jugs that he has been modeled by British and American potters for about 250 years.

title: RAILROAD TRUSTEE SOUNDS A WARNING
description: R. R. Timpany, the trustee of the bankrupt Central Railroad of New Jersey, has told the Federal District Court in Newark that the carrier can not be reorganized within a reasonable time under Section 77 of the Federal Bankruptcy laws.

title: Heard, With 68 for 133, Leads by Shot
description: MIAMI, March 8Who is this Jerry Heard? He is a talented golfer with a bubbly, carefree manner, full of a confidence that was enhanced by a tour victory less than a week ago.

title: Dance Classesfor a Little Savoir Faire
description: Thirteenyearold Robert Thornton said, I was thinkof taking the classes, but my friends aren't and I never got around to it. The first week we looked in the windows and one of us made funny noises. I didn't like that. I don't think anybody, should rake funny noises at them. If they wantto learn those dances, O.K., let them do it.

title: Barry Helps Warriors Set Back 76ers, 10696
description: PHILADELPHIA, March 8 (UPI)Rick Barry scored 28 points and Jim Barnett 26 as the Golden State Warriors defeated the Philadelphia 76ers, 106.96, tonight and remained on top of the National Basketball Association's Pacific Division.

title: The Ghost of McCarthyism
description: PARISThe young French revolutionary theorist, Regis Debray, has been refused a U.S. visitor's visa under the 1952 Immigration and Nationality Act passed by Congress during the peak of McCarthyist redbaiting. This makes little sense for a country that proclaims its openminded tolerance white Soviet Union is expelling dissident intellectuals, headed by Solzhenitsyn, simply because it disagrees with their views.

title: About the Mets . . .
description: Yogi Berra considered the fact that Las Vegas oddsmakers had installed the Cincinnati Reds and Pittsburg Pirates as the favorites in the National League, and he didn't argue. I suppose they are the favorites, he said. They've got the hitting. . . . In the Western Division, wnere the Reds play, Yogi leans toward the Los Angeles Dodgers. They got Mike Marshall for their bull pen from Montreal, he remembered. The Expos won 79 games last year and Marshall pitched 92 times and figured about half their wins. . . . It was moving day for the Mets. After two weeks at Payson Field in northwest St. Petersburg, they moved downtown to their permanent base at HugginsStengel Field . . . They will work out there from now on and dress into battle gear before taking taxis to Al Lang Field, one mile away, for their exhibition ??. When the action starts: Jon Matlack for the Mets and Alan Foster for the Cardinals.

title: Religious Implications of the Mets
description: There is a basic Jewish tradition: Everything can teach us the love of God and the service of God. In this spirit, let us now ask, what are the religious implications of the New York Mets?

Something's Inoperative
description: Neither did I know until the time of my own investigation of any efforts to provide [the Watergate defendants] with funds.

title: DualPurpose Funds
description: MARCH 8, 1974

title: 12 ON DRUG SQUAD ARE INDICTED HERE
description: Twelve present and former members of the Police Department, including two lieutenants, were indicted yesterday on Federal charges of stealing cash from narcotics dealers, reselling heroin they had seized in an arrest and offering bribes to fellow officers to hinder prosecution of drug traffickers.

title: Beer and Bread
description: The effort of Mayor Beame and other ranking officials to check the dismaying decline of jobs in New York City has produced one impressive victory and seems on its way to another.

title: J.S. WILL RELAX CURB ON RUSSIANS
description: WASHINGTON, March 8The United States will soon announce a relaxation of travel restrictions for Soviet diplomats in this country to match similar steps taken by Moscow last months. State Department officials report.

title: TV: Friends Pay Tribute to Jim Croce on Channel 5
description: Don Kirshner's Rock Concert syndicated series continues this weekend, locally on WNEW/Channel 5 at 8:30 tonight, with a tribute to Jim Croce, the folk singercomposer who was killed last in a plane crash.

title: MRS. FRANK PICKEN
description: Mrs. Isabelle Beyea Picken, who was associated with the socialservice clinic of St. Luke's Hospital here from 1920 to 1941, died of cancer Sunday in Brisbane, Australia. Her age was 72.

title: MRS. HUGH CAREY
description: Mrs. Helen Owen Carey, the wife of Representative Hugh L. Carey, Democrat of Brooklyn, died of cencer last night at Lenox Hill Hospital. She was 49 years old.

title: Slain Woman Found In Ransacked Home On S.I. by Husband
description: The body of a 20yearold Staten Island woman, her throat slashed, apparently by a burglar that she found in her home, was discovered yesterday morning by her husband.

title: Nixon Orders Saxbe to Press For Renewal of Death Penalty
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla., March 8 (AP)President Nixon, voicing concern over the fresh wave of kidnappings, has ordered Attorney General William B. Saxbe to press for reinstitution of the death penalty in cases where a kidnapping victim is killed, a White House official said today.

title: Dave Anderson The Rangers: Miracle or Mirage
description: In the dazzle of whirling red lights that symbolized the New York Rangers' 92 victory Wednesday night over the Montreal Canadiens and tranquilized their Madison Square Garden rooters, Brad Park remained a realist.

title: CORRECTION
description: A dispatch in The New York Times on Wednesday identifying Americans killed in the recent Paris air crash described Thomas P. Wright as a stockbroker. Mr. Wright was an investment banker and managing director of the Merrill Lynch BrownShipley Bank, Ltd., in London.

title: Newcombe, Gorman Win World Cup Tennis Matches
description: HARTFORD, March 8It was only a little slip, but it cost Arthur Ashe his match with John Newcombe, in the second round of the Aetna World Cup tennis tournament, 6.2, 5.7, 64.

title: Aussie Ahead in Golf
description: IPOH, Malaysia, March 8 (AP)  Michael Ferguson of Australia carded a second straight threeunderpar 69 and took a onestroke lead today after two rounds of the Malaysian open. Tied for second were Wally Kuchar of Edgewater, Fla., and Graham Marsh of Australia.

title: Jerome J. Lande, Arbitrator And G.O.P. Leader, 66, Dies
description: Jerome J. Lande, a labor arbitrator and a member of the Republican State Committee, died of a heart attack yesterday in his office at 292 Madison Avenue. He was 66 years old and lived at 315 Riverside Drive.

title: Article 4  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: Teacher Rivalry: End of Merger Talks Expected to Intensify Groups' Strife
description: In many ways, the National Education Association has come to look more like a labor union than some labor unions do. This is ironic because the chief barrier to the merger of the association and the American FederaLion of Teachers is apparently the federation's affiliation with organized labor. Even though the N.E.A., unlike the A.F.T., is not a member of the American Federation of Labor and Congress of Industrial Organizations, the education association supports collective bargaining, the closed shop and teacher strikes, and endorses sympathetic political candidates.

title: LATE JERSEY EDITION
description: General news, P. 33; sports, P. 21.

title: CORRECTION
description: A dispatch in The New York Times on Wednesday identifying Americans killed in the recent Paris air crash described Thomas P. Wright as a stockbroker. Mr. Wright was an investment banker and managing director of the Merrill Lynch BrownShipley Bank, Ltd., in London.

title: Banker Views Arab Investment
description: Arab oilproducing nations are more interested in hightechnology investment in their own countries than in largescale investment in the United States, according to Alfred F. Miossi, an executive vice president of the Continental Bank of Chicago.

title: A Sparkling Paris: Places and People
description: Like an antidote for the latewinter glooms, a bright and sparkling exhibition, Paris: Places and People, now on view at the Bronx Museum of Art (housed in the rotunda of the Bronx County Courthouse, 851 Grand Concourse), provides a number of absorbing glimpses of the French capital spanning the centuries from a crisply rendered landscape with Notre Dame in the background, painted by Jean Fouquet around 1460, to a stark view of the Rue Ravignan, the haunt of the radical cubists, done in 1913 by Maurice Utrillo. It includes such familiar landmarks as the Pont Neuf and the Place Clichyrendered by the impressionist and pointillist mastersas well as vivid sketches of Parisian life and Parisian pleasures as ob, served by such artists as ToulouseLautrec, Jean Louis Forain and Jean Franois Raffaelli.

title: ALBERTO RABAGLIATI OF ITALIAN RADIO, 67
description: ROME, March 8Alberto Rabagliati, a singer who brought American swing to Italy in the nineteenthirties and lately made, a nostalgic, comeback to the popmusic scene here, died today of cerebral thrombosis. He was 67 years old.

title: Mets Are Pronounced Fit For Preseason Opener
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., March 8On the eve of their first exhibition game, the New York Mets were pronounced physically fit today by the men who spent all last summer mending them: the team doctors.

title: Abortion Hearings
description: The hearings on abortion, conducted this week before a Senate subcommittee, were held in an appropriate forum for this controversial issue. The airing of conflicting views in such a setting is a legitimate and desirable function of the democratic process.

title: GOVERNORS INSPIRED BY A NIXON SPEECH
description: WASHINGTON, March 8 (AP)  The chairman of the nation's Republican Governors said today, I'm going to break my neck to help keep President Nixon in office.

title: LIFTING OF OIL BAN AT PARLEY IS SEEN
description: CAIRO, March 8The semiofficial Cairo newspaper Al Abram said tonight that Arab oh ministers would decide at a meeting here on Sunday to lift the embargo against the export of oil to the United States.

title: Tides Around New York
description: For high tide at Asbury Park and Belmar deduct 34 min. from SandY Hook

title: Bomb Exploded Safely
description: COVINGTON, Ky., March 8 (AP)A letter bombwas found and exploded without incident yesterday at the Internal Revenue Service Center here, the police said.

description: News Summary and Index, Page 31

title: Questions and Answers Concerning The Prices and Supplies of Gasoline
description: With supplies of gasoline ana crude oil growing and oil company profits soaring, many Americans are more skeptical than ever about the energy crisis.

title: Vietnamese Complete P.O.W. Exchange
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, March 8One long chapter of the Vietnam war ended today with the release of the last prisoners who were officially listed as captured before the ceasefire of January, 1973.

title: Pazik Makes Spring Pitch as Yanks Lose
description: POMPANO BEACH, Fla., March 8It must be spring. Mike Pazik is pitching well again.

title: The Jackson Amendment
description: If the Administration's trade bill, now before the Senate Finance Committee, is ever to become law, a compromise must be reached on the issue of tying United States trade and credits to free emigration of Jews and other dissidents from the Soviet Union.

title: Iowa Town, Aided by Farm Prosperity, Weathering the Fuel Shortage
description: FOREST CITY, Iowa  It was midafternoon, after the stock and commodity markets had closed in New York and Chicago. One by one, the merchants, farmers, and smallbusiness men drifted into the cluttered customers' room in the back of M. Wittenstein & Co., Forest City's only brokerage house.

title: ISRAEL SAYS SYRIA PLANNED ATTACK TO REGAIN SALIENT
description: JERUSALEM, March 8PreMier Golda Meir charged tonight that Syria had planned military action earlier this week to recapture the enclave of Syrian territory that Israel seized during the October war.

title: Authority for Soviet Loans Disputed
description: The General Accounting Office contends that the ExportImport Bank of the United States has no authority under a blanket Presidential order of 1972 to grant longterm naturalgas project loans to the Soviet Union.

title: Cable TV, Overextended, Is in Retreat in Cities
description: Cable television companies made a rush to wire the cities Cable television companies when the Federal Communications Commission, on March 31, 1972, issued new rules that effectively lifted a longstanding freeze on the top 100 television markets, but what many had thought would result in a communications revolution by 1974 has instead turned into a massive retreat.

title: SYRIAN DEMANDS TOTAL PULLOUT
description: President Hafez alAssad of Syria said today that his country would remain at war with Israel until all the Arab territory is liberated.

title: GAS ON WEEKEND CALLED PLENTIFUL
description: Motorists can look forward to the best weekend in more than a month, the Automobile Club of New York said yesterday, after its surveys showed that more gasoline stations would be open and operating longer hours than they had been.

title: Lawyers Disagree On Contract Signed By Rothko Executor
description: Lawyers clashed in Surrogate's Court yesterday over whether a contract signed by Theodoros Stamos, making Marlborough Gallery his representative, was relevant to charges brought against Mr. Stamos for his handling of the estate of the late Mark Rothko, the abstract expressionist painter.

title: 16 Algerian Newsmen Die in Crash at Hanoi
description: ALGIERS, March 8 (Reuters)  Thirteen Algerian journalists and 3 radio reporters covering President Houari Boumediene's tour of Asian capitals died today when their special plane crashed at Hanoi's military airfield, the Algerian news agency announced here tonight.

title: Text of a Statement by McCord on Nixon's HushMoney Remark
description: WASHINGTON, March 8Following is the text of a statement by James W. McCord Jr., a Watergate defendant, regarding President Nixon's statements on the payment of hush money to the Watergate burglars:
