description: ONE of the nicest things to do in this world is to bring pleasure to others. The energetic gardener has a real opportunity to do this. What is nicer than to have special plants available to give away to special friends when they call, especially those who are interested in gardening? Not just any old plant that you happen to have extras of, but some special surprise that is easy to grow, possibly hard to find in nursery catalogues, and with unusual value as an ornamental. There are such plants, ornamental and unusual enough so that they are easily conversation pieces wherever they are grown.

title: How to Make Sweet Music at the Box Office
description: IF Mike Nichols wants Dustin Farnum in The Graduate, said Joe Levine putting down the phone and turning to his production associates, I let Mike have him. Now, for the music, he wants Simon and Schuster. The owlishly bespectacled executive smiled amiably. I say, O.K., Mike, you can have Simon and Schuster.

title: The Sahara became a living adversary
description: South of Morocco the map of Africa becomes terribly simple: broad washes of brown and yellow, a scattering of names, a few thin lines feeling their way across the featureless space. Not rivers, but camel tracks across the emptiest desert in the world, the empty quarter of the western Sahara. That is where Geoffrey Moorhouse started out on his extraordinary camel journey from the Atlantic coast of Mauritania to the Nile, across the entire width of the Sahara. He didn't make it all the way. After three months of thirst, dysentery and sporadic hunger, with the hottest season of the year approaching, and his body punished to the limit of endurance, he gave up at Tamenrasset in the Hoggar Mountains, having walked and ridden 2,000 of the hardest

title: Letter to the Editor Community Role Is Cited
description: To the Editor:

title: Baseball Season Will Get Earliest Start on Thursday
description: The 1974 baseball season will get under way this week with the initial attention focused on Henry Aaron, who is one home run away from Babe Ruth's record of 714.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: A traveler in search of answers
description: Bennett Kremen is a freelance writer, the latest in a long line of brave souls who foraged through their native land in search of an answer to a modern version of the riddle of the Sphinx: What's America really like now?

title: Collecting Picasso and Matisse
description: EVERY private collection that attains a historical status has a twofold interest. There is, first of all, what might be called the romance of the collection. This consists of all the stories, whether mythical or historical, that attach themselves to the career of the collector. Then there are the actual works pf art, which may or may not bear some meaningful relation to the romance of the collection. It is, of course, the minor works and the outright mistakes that profit most from this element of romance. The major works just knock us over with their own power, and our interest in the career of the collector is quickly (even if not permanently) abated.

title: Unser, Vukovich Have Rides at Indy
description: INDIANAPOLIS, March 30 (UPI)Four more cars have been entered in the 500mile race at the Indianapolis Motor Speedway, with a former winner, Bobby Unser, and Bill Vukovich getting choices of two each.

title: Airline. Seeks New Route
description: AUGUSTA, Me., March 30 (AP)Eastern Provincial Airways has asked to be designated as the carrier on a new air route linking Bangor, Portland, Halifax and Montreal, the 1Vlaine Department of Transportation said yesterday.

title: Steadman Houses In Princeton Tour
description: PRINCETONThe Historical Society of Princeton will sponsor a candlelight walking tour of Charles Steadman houses and their neighbors next Sunday. Tickets at $7.50 a person, are available at the society's headquarters, Bainbridge House, 158 Nassau Street, and at each house during the fourhour tour.

title: CONSUMER GROUPS MEET IN NEWARK
description: NEWARK, March 30National and regional consumer groups opened a drive today to exert direct consumer pressure on supermarkets and food processors by having consumers take part in decisionmaking meetings with food officials.

title: The Region
description: It is showdown time again for the Transit Authority and the Transport Workers Union. When the negotiators ride off into the sunrise (probably after an allnight bargaining session), New Yorkers should have a fairly clear Idea of whether the 35cent fare has been fatally wounded.

title: Patricia M. Prince Fiancee of Lawyer
description: Mrs. Leon Nathaniel Prince of Philadelphia has announced here the engagement of her daughter, Miss Patricia Marie Prince, to Abner Paul Slatt, son of the late Mr. and Mrs. Joseph Slatt of New York.

title: The packaging of a home run
description: Last Sept. 26, Alfred di Scipio, the president the consumer electronics division of the Magnavox Company, put aside the financial reports. The first two quarters had been a wipeout. The third would probably be no better. He paced the carpet, avoidlug looking out the window at Park Avenue, looming invitingly 34 stories below. Then, hope mingling with despair, he called in his secretary and dictated a telegram to Hank Aaron of the Atlanta Braves.

title: Big Sky of Montana: Chet Huntley's Controversial Legacy
description: FOR such a gigantic and controversial project as Big Sky, the late Chet Huntley's $25million, 10,647acre resort and recreation area in the mountainous wilds of western Montana, the weekend of March 22 seemed a strange time to stage a grand openingat the end of the ski season and months before summer Vacationers were due. Big Sky's ski lifts had started operating last Dec. 15, and there had been talk of using the present season to get the bugs out so that by next winter Big Sky of Montana, Inc. could burst on the map as the state's longawaited answer to Colorado's Aspen and Vail and Idaho's Sun Valley. But the managers had hastily arranged the opening, evidently with the hope that the ailing Chet Huntley, the 62yearold former broadcaster, could preside over the official flowering of the project to which he had lent the last years of his life. Although they denied it, they knew they were racing against time, for Huntley had undergone surgery ,for lung cancer in January and was taking weekly chemotherapy treatments. His title was chairman of the board of Big Sky, but in fact he was only the celebrity fronting for the five corporations that actually own the placeChrysler Realty, Northwest Orient Airlines, Burlington Northern Railroad, Continental Oil and Montana Power. attended corporation meetings, held a 1 per cent interest in Big Sky and owned a hideaway home on the property, but he had no daytoday functionwhich may have been unfortunate because he knew Montana, he knew what he wanted to make of Big Sky and he knew how the two might be fit together. When I had heard Huntley talk about Big Sky, I realized that because he really did have a lot. of Montana manure on his boots, his feeling for the development was much more genuine than that of the builders who were actually putting the place together. Huntley died on March 20, three days before opening. If he had had any reservation about Big Sky, about the course it was taking, about the contrast between the vision and the reality, he did not voice it publicly. That wasn't his job, not this time, and of course that confused a good many people because of his previous performance. In his years on radio and television, his comments on the course of the world and nation were avidly solicited. With his giant voice, he would cut through the puffery and humble the hucksters and buffoons of the world. But his job at Big Sky was different. His job was to have his photograph on all the Big Sky ads, to defend and promote the project,

title: Erich von Daniken's Genesis
description: A few months ago I received a call from the publicity woman at Bantam Books about a oneline descriptive phrase that had appeared with the listing of Erich von Daniken's Chariots of the Gods? on the Paperback Best Seller List. Erich had been hurt by it, she told me; perhaps I would meet him when he was in town.

title: MaiTai Winner In Horse Jumping
OPINION: Cybernetics and the Jock, or Computers Are Fine but Men Are Better
description: In his hilarious but thought ful article, Opinion: A Computer that Would Absorb All, or How to Decide Baseball Salaries, on this page last Sunday, Bill Veeck asks:

title: Richard Chirls to Wed Miss Randy J. Kaplan
description: Mr. and Mrs. Irving Kaplar of Roslyn, L. I., have announced the engagement of thiir daughter, Miss Randy Jane Kaplan to Richard Chirls, son of Mr. and Mrs. Melvin Chirls of Maplewood, N. J.

title: Circus; By Jack Prelutsky. Illustrated by Arnold Lobel. Unpaged. New York: Macmillan Publishing Co. $5.95. (Ages 3 to 8)
description: I always loved the circus when I was young and I still do. What's not to like? It's sheer fantasy.. wild animals ,doing strange things that animals never do except in circuses.. loads and loads of people waiting to be amazed by the man who tiptoes across his terribly high wire... and people swinging by their pinkies on trapezes. Just being up that high would turn me green: It's a whole other world. A wonderful one.

title: Martin Goal For Hawks Tops Wings.
Playvvrights, Take Heed And Heart
description: THERE is one assertion I never, never, never want to hear again once this season is done. It is, the assertion that no truly serious play can possibly succeed on the Broadway we know.

title: She Was in a League Of Her Own in 63
description: MORRISTOWN Nancy Lotsey, a retired pitcher, watched with amusement last week as girls got to first base with the Little League..

title: FOREIGN WARES FILL NATION FETE
description: Michael Iatrides, a French student majoring in business administration at Columbia University, uncorked a bottle of Beaujolais to be sold at his booth at the 15th annual Night of Nations festival at International House yesterday, poured some into a small paper cup, took a sip and surveyed the other colorful booths around him.

title: Betty Parsons Exhibits in Montclair
description: MONTCLAIRBetty Parsons, one of the more celebrated of Manhattan's artdealers, is known less as a painter and sculptor in her own right. brated of Manhattan's art dealers, is known less as a painter and sculptor in her own right.

title: Recordings
description: FOR over 300 years, the late Renaissance Italian composer Don Carlo Gesualdo, Prinee of Venosa (c. 15601613), was considered to be one of the embarrassing lunatics of musical historya creator of unsingable music who supposedly wrote the way he did because of an obviously distempered state of mind.

title: Singletary, ExConvict, Is Back on Right Track
description: COSTA MESA, Calif., March 30 (AP)  Mike Singletary spent three years in prison and wants to go hack. But first he wants to become the world's greatest quartermile runner.

title: Miss Rankin Betrothed
description: Miss Elizabeth Bradley Rankin and Michael Meyer Geitz, who expect to graduate in December from Vanderbilt University, plan to be married in Clarksville, Tenn., on June 8 at the Madison Street United Methodist Church. Mr. and Mrs. Oscar Lane Rankin of Clarksville have announced their daughter's engagement to the son of Mr. and Mrs. William Daniel Geitz Jr. of Summit, N. J.

title: Editors Choice
description: ENORMOUS CHANGES AT THE LAST by Grace Paley. (Farrar, Straus MINUTE, & 645.) Perceptions of New York life explode like tiny bombs in these artless stories.

title: Daniel Moynihan's passage to India
description: NEW DELHI. Shortly before dawn on Feb. 20 last year, when the air was cool and the sky over New Delhi was flecked with pale, golden streaks, a Pan American jumbo jet glided to a halt an hour late at Palam airport here. Within moments, Daniel Patrick Moynihan scampered down the ramp from the first class section, a bit startled to see a waiting Cadillac with an American flag fluttering beside its hood, television klieg lights, microphones and a dozen United States Embassy officials and their carefully dressed wives, who had waited, perspiring and nervous, through the night to welcome the new American Ambassador to India.

title: Police Unit Adds a Mount
description: NEW BRUNSWICK  This is no longer a onehorse town. As of tomorrow, it will be a twohorse town.

title: The mother and father of them all
Whole Campus Pitches In to Help Salem
description: SALEM, W. Va.Salem College has never been a pretentious place.

title: Hal Boyle Scholarship Fund
description: A scholarship fund in the name of Hal Boyle, the Associated Press Pulitzer Prizewinning columnist and war correspondent, has been created by the University of Missouri. The dean of the journalism department at Columbia, Roy Fisher, said Friday that the fund was approaching the halfway point toward its goal of $40,000, according to the Associated Press.

title: More Shoppers Favor Farmers Markets
Rebecca Provda Bride
description: Miss Rebecca Jennifer Provda, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Max M. Provda of Hendersonville, N. C., and Robert Brand Finck, son of Mrs. N. Brand Finck of New York and Marshall G. Finck of Miami Beach and New York, were married in Hendersonville last evening, The ceremony was performed at Temple Agudas Israel by Rabbi Stanley Funston.

title: 4 Council Hearings Scheduled This Week
description: The following public hearings of City Council committees will be held this week:

title: The World Continued
description: HONG KONGHenry Kissinger flew to Peking last November for the sixth time in 28 months and had the longest conversation any foreigner has had with Chairman Mao Tsetung in years. A communiqu then announced that the Chairman had sent his greetings to President Nixon and that the scope of the functions of the new diplomatic missions the two countries had established in one another's capitals would continue to be expanded.

title: Inflation, a Foe Fought on Many Fronts
description: I have heard a great Any comments on my recent statement that our experience with inflation suggests no one truly knows how to control inflationat least the type of inflation we have., had in the last year.

title: Dave Anderson
description: On a basketball court, Willis Reed is more than a player. He is a presence, a symbol of success, even with a steelhinged brace on his right knee. Wes Unsaid is another presence. Despite an elastic brace on his left knee that will require surgery, he makes George Foreman appear undernourished. As the New York Knicks resume their National Basketball As soclation playoff with the Capital Bullets to day, the battle of wounded knees between Reed and Unseld looms as a decisive factor in the outcome of the fourofsevengame series. In the opener Friday night, Reed, in chunks of only seven and nine minutes, subtly but significantly influenced the Knicks 10291 victory. His dramatic entrance provoked a standing ovation at Madison Square Garden from the audience that has cherished him for a decade.

title: This Week in Sports
Steinbrenner Rocks Yankee Boat, Members of the Crew Complain
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., March 30 "We plan absent ownership as far as running the Yankees is concerned, George Steinbrenner said on Jan. 3, 1973, the day he was unveiled as the No. 1 man in the group of new Yankee owners. We're not going to pretend we're something we're not. I'll stick to building ships.

title: City May Segregate Smokers in Public
description: Smokers would have to be segregated from nonsmokers in restaurants, sports arenas and other public gathering places throughout the city under a proposed regulation to be put before the Board of Health soon.

title: Sandra G. Coxe Attended by 10 At Wedding to Paul Madden
description: Miss Sandra Gordon Coxe, a graduate of the University of Denver, was married yesterday afternoon in Greenwich., Conn., to Paul McKean Madden, a graduate of the University of Colorado. The Rev. Bradford Hastings performed the ceremony in Christ Episcopal Church.

title: Late TV Listings
description: The following information about today's television programs was not available in time to appear in Section 2:

title: LETTERS
description: To the Financial Editor:

title: Libya Nationalizes Operations of Shell
description: TRIPOLI, Libya, March 30 (Reuters)  The Libyan Government today passed a law completely nationalizing the operations here of the Royal DutchShell group, the Libyan press agency reported.

title: Shutdown of a Nuclear Plant, 17th in 19 Months, Spurs U.S. Debate
description: VERNON, Vt., March 30The Vermont Yankee nuclear Power plant has been closed down again for what officials describe as some routine tests to determine whether parts of the key element in controlling the nuclear reaction were put in upside down.

title: MEXICO SEEKING CLOSER CUBA TIES
description: MEXICO CITY, March 30 Mexico, the only LatinAmerican country that refused to break diplomatic ties with Cuba 10 years ago, is now making a determined effort to Improve her relations with the Government of Premier Fidel Castro.

title: Michigan's G.O.P. Termed Negative On Visit by Nixon
description: DETROIT, March 30 (AP)Michigan Republicans have told a White House assistant that a proposed Presidential campaign visit in Michigan next month would be disastrous for the party's candidate, a Detroit newspaper says.

title: Music:PavorattiDelights
description: Clutching a handkerchief the way Linus clutches his security blanket, Luciano Pavarotti went through a program of Italian songs and arias in Fisher Hall on Friday night. The eminent tenor sang before a full house, including a complement of stage seats.

title: MRS. ALLEN T. KLOTS
description: Mrs. Mary FitzBrown Klots, widow of Allen T. Klots, a former president of the Association of the Bar of the City of New York and a special assistant to the late Henry L. Stimson, former Secretary of State, died Friday at her home in Laurel Hill, L. I. Her age was 84.

title: Haynes Rice, 42, Is Named Deputy Health Commissioner
description: Haynes Rice, a 42yearold administrator with the Health and Hospitals Corporation, has been named deputy Health Commissioner for New York City at an annual salary of $36,620.

title: New Jersey
Oratorio
description: Of all the Handel oratorios, Israel in Egypt must be the most fun for a chorus to sing. The chorus dominates the performancethe ratio of its music to arias and duets is four to oneand it details in sound some of the most vivid scenes in Biblical history. From the plagues visited on the Egyptians to the Israelites successful crossing of the Red Sea, for these events Handel conceived some of his noblest and most colorful pages of choral writing.

title: The Bride: Tall, Quiet, Intellectual
description: We all knew she was the one all along, friends of Nancy Maginnes were saying yesterday following the disclosure that the longtime aide to former Gov. Nelson A, Rockefeller had married Henry A. Kissinger.

title: 3 April Tennis Tourneys To Close Indoor Season
description: Although pro, tennis, with all its big names, is commanding most attention, the amateur game still flourishes in the East,

title: A LongShot Pattern Holds Spotlight as Harness Fixing Trial Enters Third Week
description: At one point the other day in the racefixing trial of 13 prominent harness drivers, a puzzled defense attorney asked: Are you telling me, sir, that Mr. Gilmour is being charged with bribery in five races he won?

title: How Does It Feel To Be on a TV Quiz Show? Don't Ask
description: I AM surrounded by a lot of people who seem to be expecting something of me, and I feel totally exposed, and there are bright lights in my eyes, and it is vaguely reminiscent of something in my past. Someone whispers something meant to be encouraging, and then the familiar bumpy music plays, and I glance around quickly, looking for an available exit, but it is too late, and the familiarfrommykitchenathome voice says, And now, lets play JEOPARDY!' It is only too clear to me where I am, and I remember what the memory is: the last time I felt just about this uncomfortable was the last time I was in the delivery room. Then, as now, I wondered briefly what ever made me think I wanted to get involved in this madness.
